# esgtoolkit 

Diffusion models in Python (see [R version's intro](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/338549100_ESGtoolkit_a_tool_for_stochastic_simulation_v020))

![PyPI](https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/esgtoolkit) [![PyPI - License](https://img.shields.io/pypi/l/esgtoolkit)](./LICENSE) 
[![Downloads](https://pepy.tech/badge/esgtoolkit)](https://pepy.tech/project/esgtoolkit) 
[![Documentation](https://img.shields.io/badge/documentation-is_here-green)](https://techtonique.github.io/ESGtoolkit/)


```bash
pip install esgtoolkit
```

## Examples: 

- [https://thierrymoudiki.github.io/blog/2023/12/11/r/python/esgtoolkit-python](https://thierrymoudiki.github.io/blog/2023/12/11/r/python/esgtoolkit-python)
- [https://thierrymoudiki.github.io/blog/2023/12/18/r/python/esgtoolkit-python](https://thierrymoudiki.github.io/blog/2023/12/18/r/python/esgtoolkit-python)
- [Python code](./examples/simdiff.py)
- [Notebook](./esgtoolkit/demo/2023-12-11-simdiff.ipynb)
